inputs.selection_motivation: China credit expansion has a weaker, indirect effect on China exports compared to its direct impact on US yields, commodities, and inflation, making the link to china_exports the least substantiated.

prioritized_link.motivation: China’s credit expansion injects liquidity into global markets, lowering short‑term funding costs and directly easing the US 2‑year Treasury yield.
